text: "Snap Yo Fingers" is a song off of American rap group Lil Jon's first studio album Crunk Rock. The song was released on April 11, 2006. The song also features American rappers E-40 and Sean Paul of the YoungBloodZ. The song was able to make it to #1 on the Hot R&B;/Hip-Hop Songs, #1 on the Rhythmic, #7 on the Billboard Hot 100, #18 on the Pop 100, and #25 on the Mainstream Top 40 charts. It was also certified 2Ã— Platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). In the song, Lil Jon raps to the listener, telling them to snap their fingers and do a dance. Saying that you can do it by yourself and to not let anybody stop you. A music video for the song was released. It was directed by Hype Williams. In the video, Lil Jon, E-40, and Sean Paul rap in front of a seizure-inducing background of multiple colorful lights. Women dance and five silhouettes of a man also dance. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:2006 songs Category:Hip hop songs
title: Snap Yo Fingers
